update.description:
This implements the support to generate nightly and prerelease packages. There are two new repositories and one link:

 * packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-stable (linked to current ubuntu/ repository)
 * packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-prerelease
 * packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-nightly

There is a new parameter in the release.py script `--upload-to-repo` which if omitted defaults to stable repository to keep backwards compatibility with current uses. It accepts: stable | prerelease | nightly and send the `UPLOAD_TO_REPO` key to jenkins with that value.

The `repository_uploader` script did not require a lot of changes since reprepro works at directory level so we just need to change to repository directory and all the rest is the same. The `debbuild-base` scripts was slightly improved, but nothing substantial.

**Test run:**

 * http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat3-debbuilder-docker_test_upload/

**How to test:**

 * Add: `deb http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-nightly trusty main` to sources.list
 * sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install libsdformat3-dev


Still pending for next pull requests: run release.py daily from jenkins and port the cleanup script to S3 bucket.
update.title: Implement nightly/prerelease repositories uploads

content.raw: I've added the option to avoid the upload to the S3 container, I don't see any reason to keep nightly packages in there. If we need them individually, there is always the option to fetch them from jenkins.
content.html: I've added the option to avoid the upload to the S3 container, I don't see any reason to keep nightly packages in there. If we need them individually, there is always the option to fetch them from jenkins.

content.raw: For debian: 3.0.0-1 < 3.0.0-1~hgxxx. You can always use: `dpkg --compare versions <foo> gt <fee> && echo "yes"` to check
content.html: For debian: 3.0.0-1 < 3.0.0-1~hgxxx. You can always use: dpkg --compare versions <foo> gt <fee> && echo "yes" to check

content.raw: ok, and the version numbers take care of priority? I think this was discussed elsewhere, but I seem to have forgotten it
content.html: ok, and the version numbers take care of priority? I think this was discussed elsewhere, but I seem to have forgotten it

content.raw: Oh right, the repo is designed to be used like: stable + nightly or stable + prerelease. It is not self-contained.
content.html: Oh right, the repo is designed to be used like: stable + nightly or stable + prerelease. It is not self-contained.

content.raw: Doesn't mean it doesn't work, just means I can't test the installation without ignition-math as well
content.html: Doesn't mean it doesn't work, just means I can't test the installation without ignition-math as well

content.raw:
~~~
The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 libsdformat3-dev : Depends: libignition-math2-dev but it is not installable
                    Depends: libsdformat3 (= 3.0.0-1~hg20150727r052a15093457-1~trusty) but it is not going to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
~~~
content.html:
The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 libsdformat3-dev : Depends: libignition-math2-dev but it is not installable
                    Depends: libsdformat3 (= 3.0.0-1~hg20150727r052a15093457-1~trusty) but it is not going to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
